item.title: Misused rubbish bin- danger to drivers (6). Summary includes number of times same recurring offence reported since 16/09/2025., 21st September
item.description:
This rubbish bin is daily used for domestic rubbish. Wind often takes debris and bags to the middle of the road and it is an accident waiting to happen. I have already witnessed a motorist and a cyclist falling trying to avoid the debris. The solution is to remove the bin or to apply existing legislation and fine the recurring offenders.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, West Eaton Place, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 34 Dorset Square, 21st September
item.description:
There are now 5 bags of dumped rubbish. This spot outside 34 Dorset Square has become a dumping hot spot over the past 3/4 weeks. We would be grateful if the council could deal with these offenders. It’s a serous trip hazard for young and old on a very busy and narrow footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Dorset Square, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked sewage, 21st September
item.description:
I live in Pencraig Way and in the property where I reside has been problems with blockage shower and sink for the last year. We have already had a plumber to come and see into the property to fix the issue but the plumber said there were not issues within property and that the main issue could be coming from outside on the main pipes on the street. I have asked my landlord about it and he mentioned that is the council responsibility. We have had this issue for a very long time and neighbours have told me that they are also having some issues with slow drainage within their house. I believe it could be worth having a look into the “drainage boxes” in front of the properties to see if it needs a cleaning. I would really appreciate if this could be look at. Thank you in advance for your help.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pencraig Way, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two large trees with lots of dead branches that regularly fall into my garden, 21st September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lansdowne Road, Plaistow, London
